title: What are the cons on liberalism? - Quora

response.answer_text: Liberals are playing a long game so we often lose the short games. We think the spirit of the rules is important so are loathe to bend or break them when it is expedient. This is why trolling and sock puppeteering tends to be a conservative thing; I would be so mortified at being caught doing something like that I cringe in shame at just the thought of it, yet every day I see more and more sock puppets on the hands of conservative trolls, and not all of them have Russian accents. I often wonder at what conservatives who are obviously lying about Trump are thinking to themselves. How can you feel you are doing the right thing when you have to lie to make your point? Liberals also are bad at unity, perhaps for the exact same reasons as above. We become so concerned about the purity of our position and the importance of our own narrow concerns that we are unable to compromise when we need to. On the other hand, it means we are far less likely to fall in line and obey a charismatic leader blindly (I can hear conservatives getting heated up about Obama worship, but that was never a thing. He was an admirable man, but I wouldn't lie to protect him from a crime he committed) which is a really good thing in my opinion. But that means getting liberals in line is more difficult than herding cats; say what you will about conservatives, they sure do like lining up dressed in uniforms. Liberals can be annoyingly smug and superior, but so can conservatives. I mean, would you rather be stuck in an elevator with a vegan hippie lecturing you about how meat is murder or a evangelical zealot haranguing you about how fetuses are people? Either way, it's misery.
